image.title: World News, Today World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News, Trending News of World - Times of India

item.title: Watch: Senator Alex Padilla forcibly removed, handcuffed at Kristi Noem’s news conference; Democrats call it 'shameful abuse of power'
item.description: Democratic Senator Alex Padilla was forcibly removed and handcuffed during Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem's Los Angeles press conference, sparking national outrage. Padilla interrupted Noem to question immigration raids, leading to a confrontation where he was pushed to the ground. Democrats condemned the incident as an abuse of power, while Republicans defended Noem, accusing Padilla of inappropriate behavior.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump’s immigration shift? 'They've turned out to be great,' says US President on farm workers; watch video
item.description: US President Donald Trump hinted at a potential policy shift on immigration, suggesting some undocumented immigrants could stay to prevent labor shortages in agriculture and hospitality. An executive order is being considered to protect farm workers, many of whom lack legal status but have worked for years.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Boeing 787 safe to fly? US says no current evidence for grounding; Air India crash under review
item.description: Following the Air India Boeing 787 crash in Ahmedabad that killed over 240 people, US officials stated there's no justification to ground the aircraft. The FAA and NTSB are sending investigators to India to assist, emphasizing a commitment to safety and data review. They assured swift action if any safety concerns arise during the investigation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 500,000 affected: Trump admin revokes humanitarian parole for 4 nations; tells them to leave US
item.description: The Trump administration is terminating the humanitarian parole program, initiated by the Biden administration, impacting approximately 532,000 immigrants from Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua, and Venezuela. Notices have been sent, effective immediately, revoking their work authorization and legal status.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘You’re unfit to lead’: Hegseth grilled over Signal chats, Greenland invasion plan
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth faced intense questioning from the House Armed Services Committee regarding potential invasion plans for Greenland and Panama. His use of encrypted Signal chats for military operations raised concerns about protocol breaches and potential leaks of classified information.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why is Greta Thunberg putting her hands behind like she's handcuffed? Internet debates
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.6 jolts Pakistan
item.description: As per the NCS, the earthquake occurred on late Thursday, at a shallow depth of 10km, making it susceptible to aftershocks.

item.title: 'Goodbye India': Who was UK's celebrity wellness guru Jamie Meek, feared to be dead in the Air India crash?
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump on Ahmedabad crash: ‘They’ll handle it’; calls it among worst in history
item.description: US President Donald Trump expressed his condolences following the Ahmedabad plane crash, calling it a “horrific crash.” He offered immediate American assistance to India, emphasizing their readiness to help. Trump speculated on the possible cause, suggesting potential engine failure while acknowledging the ongoing investigation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Dubai RTA deploys AI robot for metro inspections: Here’s what it can really do
item.description: Dubai's RTA has launched ARIIS, an AI-powered robotic system, to inspect and monitor the Dubai Metro's rail tracks. This innovation dramatically reduces human labor by 75%, enabling faster, more thorough inspections and minimizing human error. ARIIS uses LiDAR, high-resolution lasers, and 3D cameras for real-time analysis and proactive maintenance, enhancing safety and efficiency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Uber?' Indian-origin man in Australia claims he countered McDonald's staff after he was mistaken as delivery driver
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harvey Weinstein rape charge: New York judge declares mistrial after jury feud
item.description: A New York judge declared a mistrial in Harvey Weinstein's rape case concerning Jessica Mann, due to intense jury disputes. This followed Weinstein's conviction for sexually assaulting Miriam Haley and acquittal on Kaja Sokola's allegations. Weinstein, already serving a 16-year sentence in California, faced discord among jurors, including reported threats.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump met with cheers & boos at ‘Les Misérables’ debut amid Kennedy Center boycott
item.description: Donald Trump's attendance at 'Les Misérables' opening at the Kennedy Center was met with mixed reactions amidst political tensions. Trump dismissed concerns about cast boycotts, asserting his focus on running the country effectively. The performance, mirroring themes of resistance, saw audience members chanting and booing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: David Beckham's son hires same lawyer Prince Harry, Meghan Markle have to sever ties with parents
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Kennedy must fall’: CIA releases 1,450 pages on Robert F Kennedy assassination
item.description: The CIA has declassified 1,450 pages related to Robert Kennedy's 1968 assassination, including a psychological profile of Sirhan Sirhan and his chilling notes. These documents may shed light on Sirhan's motives and potential international connections. The release also reveals RFK's cooperation with the CIA during a 1955 visit to the Soviet Union.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'South California over South Africa any day': Scott Bessent's first reaction to claims that Elon Musk hit him
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UAE firm introduces long-lasting meals designed to be eaten up to 25 years later
item.description: Red Planet, a UAE-based company, is set to revolutionize food security with its ready-to-eat meals boasting a 25-year shelf life. Utilizing advanced freeze-drying technology, these halal-certified meals retain taste and nutrition without artificial preservatives. Targeting humanitarian aid, armed forces, and space agencies, Red Planet's diverse menu includes local Emirati and international dishes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
